intro: Sanicula europaea var. elata, commonly known as tall European sanicle, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes many aromatic plants such as carrots and parsley. The plant is characterized by its upright stems and compound leaves with a distinctive, fern-like appearance. Its small, yellowish-green flowers are arranged in umbels, typical of the Apiaceae family. The plant is often found in moist meadows and along stream banks, thriving in temperate climates.
